intro: Pelea wahiawaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian pelea, is a rare endemic plant species native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are generally elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Pelea wahiawaensis is considered critically endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
